text: Cherries, funk, leather, vinegar in nose. Pours red with pink head. Taste is sour with lots of juicy cherries, funk, vinegar, nicely balanced especially for Hanssens lambics. Very tart finish, average to lively carbonation. Overall very good.
Shared 12.7. oz. bottle. 2015 edition. Pours a dark ruby with a small light pink head. Fruity cherry nose. Taste is sour cherries, oak, acetic acid. Very tart finish. Nice.

Aroma: tart and sour; Appearance: murky crimson pour with thin white head that disappears; Taste: follows nose with notes of vinegar; Palate: light bodied with long, vinegar finish; Overall: good but not the best lambic Ive had.

From a 375 cl bottle purchased at Trio in Kitty Hawk. Bottled in 2015. Pours a clear deep rose with a slight pink head. Aroma of cherries is powerful and inviting. Flavors of sour cherries and red wine. Sour but refreshing finish.
Outstanding lambic. Rich aroma, nice souerness. The best barrel notes i ever tasted.

Bottle, courtesy of yngwie. Pours deep purple with a tiny off-white head. Aroma of cherries, spices, fruitiness, some lemon and cherry pits. Flavor is sweet and sour with some cherries, cherry pits, lemon and spices. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle, 75cl corked. From a trade with clubgonzo. Its a murky red beer with a pinkish head of moderate size. Lots of alcohol or higher alcohol in the aroma, nail polish remover or vinegar. Vinegar I guess, cause its damn nice. Cherries, almond notes, lemon, barnyard and leather. Its tart and medium bodied, with a nice carbonation. Even more tart actually. Cherries, some almond, lemon and barnyard in the flavor. Sour cherries. Hints of vinegar. Lasting leathery cherry finish. A very complex and tasteful beer indeed. Hanssens-tart and delicious. 170516

Bottle 750ml @ geokkjer
Pours dark hazy red/purple with a small purple head. Aroma is tart with notes of sweet cherry, vinegar, funk and barnyard. Taste is medium sweet and medium to heavy sour with a long dry, cherry, tart and funky finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
At koelschip, pours deep red no head, aroma of cherries, fruits, cherries stones, flavor is sour with lots of cherries, acidic, vinegar, lemony, zesty, medium bodied
KØLF 021216. Deep red color with a pink head. Aroma is sourness, almond, cherries. Flavor is sourness, cherries, almond, yeast. Wow this is great.
Succulent kriek! Heavenly aroma. Sour, tender, lively, light cuberdon, sour. With the bottom added, it is even nicer.
Aroma of sour cherries. Dark red with a purple/red head. Perfect sour sweet fruitiness. Medium body, creamy texture & average carbonation. Fantastic.

At Haket Beer Festival Batch #2, April 15, 2017.Bottled.Hazy to cloudy to murky red color, no head. Cherry pips, alcohol, tart, cherry scent. Sour, acetic acid taste. Acetic acid aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, no bitterness.
Clear deep pink-red color with no head. Aroma is very dry and woody with obvious cherry pits. Flavour is similar but very tart and sour. Quite perfumed.
Backlog. Vinegar, almost nail polish, cherries, barnyard, hay, pineapple. Heavy sour, acidic.

(bottle, 37.5cl) Deep red coloured hue with a short and pink frothy rim. Intense aroma of krieken-morelos with notes of almonds, accompanied by acidic lambic funkiness and shades of sweetness. Sour-tart flavour, light to medium bodied, soft on carbon. Acidic and intense cherry-fruity taste with funky notes, almonds, hints of marzipan, even some discreetly fruity sweetness in the background; lasting acidic-tart and cherry-fruity finish. Superb. 30.IX.16

375ml bottle @One pint pub. Thanks Euphemos. 
Poured deep red in color with a thin white head. 
Barnyard, cellary notes, cherries in aroma. 
Flavor has cherries, acid, barnyard, green apples. Very very dry finish.

Smells like nail polish at first, after some time it gets better and smells like cherries, leather, vinegar, vanilla.
Rather high sourness in taste. If not for the vinegar, it would be a great lambic.

Bottle 375ml. corked @ [ Morten minus Peter Tasting ]. [ As Hanssens Oude Schaerbeekse Kriek ].[ Trade by Zakoon ]. Clear medium to dark red color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white - pink head. Aroma is moderate to heavy barnyard, leather, cheery, wood, funky, almonds, tart cherries. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, tart, wood, cheery, super dry, barnyard, funky, almonds, tart and sweet cherries. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20170401]
 9-4-8-4-17

Rød klar skum hvid 
Krisebær citrus gær eddike stald frugt
Bitter lidt sur lidt 
Tør blød 
@f1

Bottle almost certainly picked up at Dranken Geers, Oostakker, nr Gent, Belgium consumed at home Sunday 26th March 2017 whilst cooking Moussaka outside.  Pours dark old blood, dark cherry red, there was a barbie pink head but this swiftly departed. Wow this is sour and fruity tart, a damn good workout for the gums and tastebuds. Really drying on the finish, I can even feel my stomach juices getting an acidic once over. Great, if a little bit of a sour challenge. A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8
Quite sour throughout, cherries added some nice sweetness to round out the beer. Big cherry finish.

750ml bottle @ Matts. Pours a cloudy purple colour with a small white head. Nose is cherries with an almost boozy tang. Flavour is so much cherry, while maintaining a tart/sour character that doesnt compromise a subtle sweetness.
Bottle - Big sweet maraschino notes and cooked cherry. Deep cloudy red with a small white head. Acidity is a bit overpowering but cherry and maraschino notes.

Cloudy and dark purple. Doesnt look great, and there is no head. The aroma has some acetic, dark rich cherries, almonds. Sharp, acetic, very tart finish, with a bit of woodiness. The cherry has that same almond note I got on the nose, and I love the deep, dark cherry to this. The lambic funk is somewhat restrained, in terms of classic lambic notes. A bit jammy in the finish, really.

750mL bottle, pours a murky dark red with a small pinkish head. Aroma brings out shitloads of sweet and tart cherries, and lovely barnyard funk. Flavour is on the acidic side, with lots of sweet and tart cherries, light-moderate barnyard funk, and vinegar. Lovely funk combined with the intense cherries. Excellent stuff.
Bottle 0.375l at home, Nivala. Bottled JAN 2015. Colour is deep slightly cloudy red with very small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, red berries, blue berries, some sweetness and sourness.

Klar, mörk röd, rött skum. Doft: Surt körbärs vin, gräs, ganska mild/mjuk funk, lite jordgubbar, svettiga strumpor. Smak: Som doft fast lite tydligare funk, syra och körsbär. Låg kolsyra. Mycket god eftersmak av mogna lätt sura körsbär.
Bottle shared at the TST/TWAT. Pours red with a small white head. Lots of cherry, red currant, raspberry. Overly sour, acidic, lovely fruit character though.

375ml. Bottled Feb 2015. Deep dark crimson color. Aroma is cherry pit, concentrated cherry juice, some lambic funk and wine oak. Taste is sour cherry, sour lemon. A little more sour and acidic than average for a Belgian sour but enough fruit flavor to balance it out. Some leather, oak and Belgian funk round it out. IMO, every bit as good as the big boys from cantillon and 3F.

Bottle from a friend. Dark ruby color, minimal pink head. Sour taste with cherry, acidic notes, tart, sour apples and red currant. Sour finish with cherry, acidic notes,tart, red currant and tart. Excellent kriek.

Bottle, 6%. Deep red/ruby with tiny head. Aroma is malt, cherries, tart, wood, cherry stones and tart. Flavour is malt, cherries, medium sweet, tart, lemon, sour, little acid, cherry stones and vinegar.

Flaska från Beergium. BF 2034, tappad på flaska för drygt ett år sedan. Mörk djupröd med litet rosa skum. Stor, intensiv doft av körsbär, syrliga körsbärskärnor, bittermandel och aceton. Mediumstor. Stor syrlighet och massor av syrliga körsbär och körsbärskärnor, körsbärsvinäger och citronjuice. En djup syrlighet som nästan bränner till. Mängder av körsbär!

Oude kriek (schaerbeekse) hanssen
Lukt: körsbär vinäger, tjockt, underbart, bittermandel, funk, papprigt, 
Smak: väldigt syrligt, citron, körsbär, mandel, papper, aningen aceton, lite laktoslenhet.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2017 Nowa ocena: totalnie zdominowane przez agresywny ocet, kwasowość żre wręcz w gardło :(

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Łódź panel #15 Mega kwaśne, wytrawne, owocowe, z wyraźnym octem. Fajne.
Bottle. Dark red beer, almost no head. Nose is cherry juice, tart notes, dry, malts. Flavor is tart, cherries, malt, wood. Pretty krieky.

Aroma has a bit of funk in it with the fruity nose. Deep clear rose, no head. Taste is very tart, deriving from this style of cherry. Good lambic. Sharp finish. Funk in the after taste provide balance.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy deep ruby with a small pink head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy sour cherries, vinegar and wood. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Bone dry and rather acidic finish. 200117

Bottle, bottled 01.2016 (from Pothouse). Pours brownish dark red. Aroma is sour, vinegar, cherries, corked wine, acetone, vanilla, oak. Flavor is sour, acidic, cherries, vinegar, oak, vanilla, some corked wine and acetone. Drinkability is low, Overall: can drink it when Im forcing it, but way too much vinegar to be enjoyable. Would rather drink something else and use this for salad dressing.
Pours dark red. Aroma is solvent, sour, cherries, fruits, some caramel sugar, wooden notes. Taste is sour, acid, vinegar, clove, cinnamon, salty, pumpkin, wooden, mushroom. Salty and true acid beer!

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 bottle@ Gambrinus. Pours dark (cherry) red, almost no head. Aroma: sour, acidity, rotten cherries, dark chocolate, vinegar. Taste: heavy sour, acidity attacks your stomache, balsamico and vinegar, sour cherry peals. Medium body. Sour-acidity finish. Drink only if you like really sour beers.

Disig rödlila öl med ett lätt rosa skum. Doft av körsbär, vinägersyrlighet och lättare trätoner. I smaken tillkommer lätta mandeltoner och likaledes lätt funkighet. Syrligheten är distinkt utan att göra ölen svårdrucken.

Data ważności:  07.08.2034 
 Kolor:  Różowo-czerwony. Piwo jest zamglone. Przykładając szkło pod żarówkę tylko w niektórych miejscach widać prześwity światła. 
 Piana: Nieciężko zgadnąć, że jest ona licha i opada z prędkością światła do milimetrowej otoczki.
Piękny różowy kolor, którym niestety nie można zbyt długu się nacieszyć.
Po zakręceniu szkiełkiem tylko pojedyncze kropeczki na jego ściankach. 
 Zapach:  Ach jak ja kocham ten klimat! Już sam korek pachnie obłędnie, nie wspomnę już o zawartości butelki.
Zdecydowanie królami balu są wiśnie - kwaśne i cierpkie.
Dodać do nich należy odrobinę czerwonej porzeczki. Z tyłu nuty skórzanego paska, wiejskie, stajenne.
Po ogrzaniu odrobina wanilii.
Lekka dzikość i dominująca owocowość.
Mógłbym to wąchać bez końca. 
 Smak:  Winny, solidnie kwaśny, chwilami nawet octowy. Dominują świeże, kwaśne wiśnie.
Jest także posmak czerwonej porzeczki.
Drugoplanową rolę grają (podobnie jak w zapachu) akcenty skórzane, stajenne. Są one jednak daleko z tyłu.
Wanilia i czerwone wino gdzieś tam przemknie.
Zaskakująca kombinacja.
Po kilku łykach octowa strona trunku zaczyna coraz mocniej o sobie dawać znać.
Wyraźne, intensywne octowe posmaki.
Tekstura jest gęsta jak galaretka wiśniowa. Czuć w ustach musujący charakter trunku. 
Średnie nagazowanie i okrągłe odczucie w ustach.
Klasa! 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Genialny owocowy Lambic.
Nie dziwie się dlaczego wiśnie zbierane w rejonie Schaarbeek cieszą się tak wysoką renomą. Dają one fenomenalne owocowe, ale przede wszystkim kwaśne i octowe nuty.
Octowość trunku jest wybitna. Środkową warstwę stanowią nuty wanilii i czerwonej porzeczki. Stajenne, skórzane, wiejskie detale są daleko w tle.
Oude Kriek jest intensywny w smaku i zapachu, złożony i nieprawdopodobnie zbalansowany.
Rewelacyjny Kriek, ale wciąż nie najlepszy jaki piłem w życiu;)
Murky blood red. Not one trace of head. Huge aroma of vinegar. Taste is extremely sour cherries with a puckering finish.

375 ml bottle. Practically clear, deep red body with a small pink head. Aroma is simply fantastic, mature cherry, cherry stone, almond and acid. Flavor is great as well, lots of cherry, very sour cherry with almond and cherry stone, some residual sweetness from berries and dry cherry skin. Fine balanced body and everlasting aftertaste. Normally not too keen anymore at Kriek as they seems to be a bit one dimensional and actually prefer the aged one with less cherry and more Geuze flavor, but this one nails it.

Superb lambic. Cherry and slightly sour yeast on the aroma, the cherry flavour is so fresh and juicy, then a great sour finish cleans it away, but the sourness is so well balanced, it doesnt destroy your palate. World class !

Bottle, 37.5 cL, bottled January 2015. Pours cloudy rich ruby with a small, effervescent and quickly dissipating pink head which leaves a thin ring at the glass. Aroma is heavy tart cherries, medium earthy black walnuts, light cinnamon and nutmeg spices, oak and graham cracker malt. Flavor is puckering tart cherries, lactic acid notes, light graham cracker malt, earthy spices and black walnuts with a dry finish. Light body and carbonation.

Bottled 750ml (bottled 08/2016, Systembolaget Umea)
Deep red color, no much head. Acidic nose has riped cherry in it. Medium-bodied. Mouthpuckering tart cherry lambiek and cherry flavor. Aftertaste is drying. Not so fruity kriek but extremely sour. Probably mellows over the time, or ...

Deep ruby colour, small pink head. Aroma is sour cherries, some wood, and mild blueberries as well. Flavour is tart wood, cherries, some slight earthy notes as well. Nicely dry and tart.

375ml bottle from Kihoskh. Bottled Jan 2016. Pours deep reddish with a tiny head. Aroma of sour cherries, dark berries, earthiness, farmyard and funky notes. Taste is heavy with cherries, some mild sourness, tartness, loads of berry juice, hints of earthiness and funky notes. Finish has massive amounts of cherries and berries, some sourness, funky notes and mild earthy farmyard notes. Quite intense amount of cherries here, and quite mildly sour. As it warms up, some vinegary notes start to dominate.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 375ml bottle (Koht, Tallinn)
Deep red, brief loose head. On pouring, sourness and blackcurrant juice. In the glass, a fairly sour aroma, sharp black cherry skins. Dry, stones, woody, bit of glue.. Palate is super crazy sour - actually vinegary. Faces pulled after sipping this have previously featured in pictures of nazi concentration camps. Taste is dominated by the vinegar, which is way tool high, then theres cherry stones and wood, and a bit of cherry skins. Acidic can be good, but acetic is bad, and this is acetic. Love the cherry, but vinegar sucks. (Anna gets the vinegar only shortly after swallowing and otherwise finds mainly the young sour black cherry - and their pits - aspects.)

375ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Slightly hazy redish color. Medium size, bubbly pink head, stays. Sour, cherries, farty, some sugar and balsamic vinegar in aroma. Sour, acidic, fruity, cinnamon, vinegar and cherries in taste. Cinnamon and cherries and acidic vinegar in aftertaste. Acidic balsamic brew. Not bad, but why the fuck?

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Kriek Schaerbeekse (2016) by Hanssens Artisanaal at Apartamenty Saska nad JezioremOcet ocet ocet. I wisnie. W tle troche jakicjs ciekawszych nutek, jakies migdaly, malo dzikosci, mocno tanin, mocno kwasnyOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 Barwa wiśniowa, piana średnio intensywna, szybko całkowicie zanika. 
Aromat owocowy, wiśnie, kompotu z czereśni. W tle nuty skórzaste i słodka wanilia. 
Wysoka kwaśność. Piwo jest zaskakująco pełne i wyraźnie wiśniowe. Posmaki octowe obecne. Finisz jest cierpki i wytrawny, nieco pestkowym charakterem. Po przełknięciu w gardle pozostaje delikatnie słodki posmak owoców.

0,75 l bottle from kappldav123. Thanks a lot! Shared at home with Kristall-König. Dark red in the glass, no head. Cherrie sweet with tart fruitieness on the nose. Low carbonation. Some cheese in the background. Dry. Increasing sourness to end.
Bottle care of Dave, pours a cranberry plum red with small ring of head. Notes of cranberry purée, sour cherries, cinnamon, oak, vinegar and lactic acids. Puckery and sour as fuck

Draught
Aroma-barnyard, cherry, berries
Appearance-red, cloudy, rouge foam
Taste-heavily sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Dark pink/purple with a light ring for a head. Cherries, tart, acidic, lightly funky wood and basement on the nose. Great palate, heavy wood, tart cherry, funk, barnyard and a smooth finish.

Aromat jest absolutnie obezwładniający, intensywna wiśnia, czereśnia, nieco nutek zielonych, muśnięcie wanilii, nie ma tu klasycznej lambikowej stajni. Jest inaczej, jest doskonale. W smaku wchodzimy już na bardziej znane rejony, piwo bardzo intensywne, wysoka kwaskowość, lekki ocet, cierpkość wiśni, wręcz gęste odczucie w ustach, finisz długi, cierpki, przyjemny. Pije się to małymi łyczkami, intensywność obezwładnia. Top w tym stylu.

Bottled 2/16. Deep red with a pink head that lingers at the rim. 4+ Amazing cherry aroma - booming sweet jammy ones, intense brash sharp ones too. Some marzipan, lemon, bracken. Not much body really. Carbonation is there but only just - lovely. Big cherry hit with what I presume is the illusion of sweetness, then fairly full-on sourness which is somewhat lemony but mainly lactic. Edging up to too acidic, but it the lambic has to be pretty savage to match the amazing fruit. Great.

Bottle from Rudat. Sour fruity nose. Great intense red in the glass. The beer starts sour with nice cherries in the back. Not too much acidity, the beer is sour but fruity. the cherries are fresh and fruity, the fruity sourness is smooth and not too overwhelming. Round and fruity sourish aftertaste. Very interesting sour fruity brew. But for me a bit too much on the vinegar-acid-side.

750ml bottle from Systembolaget. Deep purple with a pink/white head, no lacing. Phenolic aroma, cherries and raspberry jam. Medium carbonated, tart mouthfeel. Berries and cherry taste, tart and fruity.

duft kirsebær manler kant karamelsød cherry kant en kant af træ /fad
smag. sur tør funkey tør kirsebær kant af grøn katus svamp muk agtig eftersmag kirsebær svag sølig rød frugt

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 37cl bottle. Deep burgundy pour with a light burgundy head. Tons of sour cherries in the aroma and taste, macerated sour cherries, sour grapes, red grape vinegar, some nice toasted almonds and roasted chestnuts notes in there, with some sherry in the post-taste. Medium body, light carbonation and a very tart finish. A damn fine kriek.

Pours a hazy purple red from the bottle with bubbly pink head that dissipates quickly to leave light lace. Aroma of tart cherries and funky must, a hint of oak and acidity. Taste is the funk up front, then subtle sweet and tart cherry notes, leading to a bright acidity and lingering musty funk. Soft carbonation, really nice.

Bottle. 
Hazy deep red pour, no head. 
Slightly sour nose, very sour but crisp taste. Abrupt sour finish with a slight cherry note. 
Full body, soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pours thick purple with a small pink head. Notes of marzipan, sweet cherry candy, vinegar, light lactic, citrus, cherry pits.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a taster showing unfiltered wine red with no head. The nose shows extremely concentrated bing cherries with a balanced background of vanilla. Without any exaggeration, I would rate this nose beyond a ten. I have simply never experienced anything this balanced, fruit forward, or concentrated. The palate is full bodied and lightly carbonated. Flavors of the strong cherries balanced with vanilla. Strongly tart with a resurgence of cherries and vanilla on the finish.Once again extremely concentrated and well balanced. The only small criticism I might say is the tartness causes a bit too much puckering but still an incredible beer.

Dark ruby, blood hued body with a thin cap that rapidly fades to nil. Grand aroma of cherries, huge vanilla presence, oak. The flavor brings additional notes of pie dough, butter (positive attribute), cherry pie. Medium high acidity with low carbonation. Delicious.

37.5cl bottle. Hazy dark red with almost no head. Sour, cherries and wood in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium to light body. Taste is tart and bittersweet with fruity notes. Quite complex. Overall, a very good beer.
Bottle thanks to Zach. Pourd reddish purple color no head. Jammy cherry nose. Tart cherry nose, leather, bactine, raspberry, medium sourness, low carb. Long tart finish.

No head to speak of. Magnificent ruby/garnet colour, bright. Nose like a crate of sour cherries dropped. Lactic acid. Sour cherries, utterly natural. Wood also, dry wood, vinous to a certain extent. Horseblanket, slightly smoked (dare I say sacch...?)Astringet through the acidity, fruitacids in the aftertaste. Superb kriek, ranking amongst the best.

Bottle: Cloudy, blood-red coloured, small pinkish head; solid sour and fruity nose, almonds, ripe cherries and malic acid included; very solid sour flavour, medium bodied annd not too tart; lingering almondy and cherry-like finish with a good amound of malic acid in the aftertaste. Very demanding, very pleasant...

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Deep burgundy colour, small head. Tart woody cherry aroma. Tart with light-medium body and rounded, spritzy mouthfeel. Vinegar and wood, wildly aromatic cherries. Mostly sour with distinct citric acid, very little funkiness, cobewebs. Mild cherry stone bitterness. Elegant, but not complex.

Something special for my 50th rating. Bottle from Saveur Biere. Pours deep red with very small depleting pink head. Nose is cherry and a bit acidic. 
Taste starts sweet and full of cherry, heavy carbonation. Palate is full of dark Fruits, mostly sour cherries. Finish is a bit dry in the throat. Such a nice sipper!

Couleur pourpre, très légère mousse. Nez cerise, boisé, note de vinaigre, acidulé, alumette brulée,. Gout cerises-fruits rouges, vinaigré, acidulé, phenol, boisé vieux fut, fin bien aigre, acidulée. Nickel.

Bottle 37.5. An amber red beer with pink head. Nose is on wild yeast, cherries and oak, some burnt touch. Taste is acid, tart, dry, with vinegar touch, aroma is on cherries, wild yeast, red fruits, tannic, some burnt notes, wood. Very acid finish, burnt notes, wood and cherries.

375ml bottle from Saveur-Biere


Blueberry colour with a small white head. Soursoursour goodness, could drink all day long.

From bottle thanks to the almighty Magnus. Pours a murky deep reddish pour with a smal pink head. Aroma has heavy vinous fruit notes, vanilla, light acetone, oak. taste is juicy fruity up front, but gets suuuper dry, tannic, sour and just makes your mouth and throat shiver. Oaky vanilla and light marzipan in a somewhat sweetish late after taste. Super oily and full bodied, low carbonation.

Ruby red with a pinkish head. Aroma is cherry juice, lightly funky cherries, hint of red wine. Medium bodied, well carbonated, fruity and acidic on the palate with a dry finish. Taste is cherries, red wine vinegar, sour cherries. Tasty.

Sour and tart cherry, marzipan and flowers. Plenty of wooden barrel, resembles wine, bit of hay and wet leather. Low carbonation and medium body. For drinking by small sips and checking whats going on this time ;)

Bottle from Biernavigatie, dated Jan 2015, large sample. Hazy redbrown color, short frothy head. Aroma of soft cherry, marzipan, bit oak wood, slight tartness. Soft sour in taste, very fruity, cherries, slight citric, bit lactic. Wonderfully balanced. Great stuff.

At the MBR Sour Beer tasting. Thanks to whoever brought it! Blood red I reckon, though it was getting dark. Plastic & cherry sour aroma, not as great as Id hoped. The taste, however is. Lovely perfumey marzipan and cherry taste, quite on the tart side. Lovely and a bit unbalanced at the same time, I can see why people are raving about it and I hope to try it again on my own.

Deep red, claret color. Tiny, pink, non-persistant head to it. Amazing aroma - typical lambic, wild, wooden barrel, funky, sour notes with deep, thick, sweet, fresh squeezed cherry. Its so pleasant just to smell this beer. In taste its super tart, really sour. Making the saliva just fill your mouth. After few sips its not THAT sour any more, its getting more and more cherry. The fruit owns the whole theme of this beer. Event the sourness is starting to be more fruity than just plain lemon-kind lambic sourness. It doesnt have much of vinegar notes which is cool. Very refreshing, quite drinkable. Its an awesome beer. Class for itself.
Butelka. Świetny wiśniowy i winny aromat, dobrze wymieszany ze skórą, sianem. Smak średnio kwaśny, mocno wiśniowy, cytrynowy i winny, trochę beczki i wina. Bardzo smaczne.

dark ruby colour, minimal pinkish-ruby head, which disappears quickly; aroma of sour cherry, woody notes, tannines, some citruses and tart; taste is dominated by sourness with sour cherry, red wine notes and intensive woody-tannin notes; great lambic

Style et résumé: Vrai oude kriek acide 
Comment: Bouteille partagée de 750ml. avec SlovakSniper. 07/08/2034.
Description:  Une robe rouge avec une mousse rose qui ne fit que passer. Un nez agréable de vin rouge-rosé de saigné, de bois avec des cerises. Le tout semble rond, mais je me trompais. La bouche est tranchante, vinaigrée et acide. Pour palais avisé. 
Note:  7+/10

Bottle
Red, light pink head
Aroma of cherry jam, aceton.
Taste sour, vinegar. Cherry.

Bottle. 
Pours dark red. 
Aroma of acetone and cherries. 
Vinegar, cherries, heavy and smooth.
Bottle. Intense aroma of flowers and cherries. Taste has got notes of cherries, roses and vanilla. Strange bitterness in the aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours deep red with a pink head. Aroma has notes of vanilla and beetroot. Taste has a deep tone of cherries and notes of vinegar. Finish is a bit bitter.

750ml bottle. Deep ruby red colour of strawberry jam and light carbonation. Aroma of cherries, brett and vinegar. Tart, naturally medium sweet w/ no added sugar, lots of brett, hay, some vinegar, cherries, cherries, cherries. A top notch kriek, not sure Ive had one better, only different.

(750 ml. 07/08/2034) Dun rouge plus que rouge, cette robe montre une timide tête rose. Au nez, les cerises qui sont énormes rencontrent des parfums épicés, boisés et acides. Au goût, le fruité est totalement rouge mais aussi tenace en acidité. Les permières gorgées sont difficiles et les suivantes charment le palais. En bouche, le corps est huileux tandis que le pétillement est amoidri au maximum. En finale, la sensation acide est intense mais domptable. Cette oude kriek na pas la finesse pour être dans les meilleures.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, red fruit, cherry, brettanomyces and acidity.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque red/ruby beer with a slight/medium pink head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, red fruit and cherry; ends slightly sour and dry with brettanomyces and acidity.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Smells, looks and tastes like cherry juice without added sugar; marvelous.

37,5 cl bottle @ home. Bottled 01/2015, BBE 07.08.2034
Aroma has earthy notes and tart cherries. Also sweetish cherry juice. Flavour has some vinegar, earthy notes, tart cherries and woody tones. Palate is low on CO2 but it does not disturb that much. Acidic, but not the most acidic kriek Ive had. Pleasantly balanced actually.
Bottle. Dark red pour, with a small fizzy pink head. Cherries, dry, tart, lemon grass, brett funk, sour cherries, and oak.

Tart, vinegar, lots of cherries, some light coconut, woody, earthy, just lovely and very rich.
Red colour, very deep, vinelike, no head.
Heavy tartness, but also some noticable sweetness, very low bitterness, woody, vanilla and again some coconut, a veritable explosion of cherries.
Medium body, round mouthfeel, low carbonation, tart and cherry finish.
Superb.
Beer tasting @ 4/8-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity with cherries, cinnamon, brett and wood, also acidic with vinegar. Body is medium, the finish is fruity and acidic with vinegar.
Tasting @ fillepolo 20160804. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and acidic with cherries and oak, funky, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry, acidic and fruity.
Bottle from systembolaget @ fillepolos. Pours a dark redish colour beer with a small head. Fruity with cherries, brett, sourness with notes of Wood. Dry finish

750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Opague dark red with a medium pink head. Sour aroma with cherries and funk. Taste reflects the aroma. Low body, with a dry texture. Low bitterness. Medium carbonation.

Smälls of sour cherries in a very nice way..dark red low carbon and almost no head. Never the less... Looks great
Taste is quite complex, first smooth cherry taste then a very sharp, great, sour test.. It rolls of and some wood, oak, flawors. A quite wonderful Kreik.

750 mL bottle. Pours a deep red. Smells of intense cherry and a touch of vinegar. Very acidic smelling. A bit of lemon. Tastes immensely sour. Sour cherries and sour vinegar. Some oak and then more sour vinegar and lemon in the finish. Way too sour for me. Overwhelms every other flavor with sourness.

Bottle generously shared by Randall. Deep ruby pour with a pinkish head. Sour cherry and funk bouquet. Tart with extremely sour cherry highlights. Malts and muted vinegar backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.

Pours a deep ruby red. Cant get any closer to deep ruby than this. Sports a slight pinkish white semi dfnse head that stays along the edge of the glass. The nose has mostly rich cherry, light yoghurt sensation and a light tutti frutti thing.. Could be the barrel adding vanilla undertones to the rich cherry fruit. Great nose.. The taste is pretty much as the nose but with a lemonny element in the finish. Getting pretty dry after a while. The body is medium full with a light carbonation. One of my favourite fruity regular lambics.
Bottle:Deep red (almost purple) with a very small head.Huge sour cherry aroma with notes of marzipan.Low carbonation.Big, sourish cherry flavour with notes of iron and marzipan. Acidic finish.

09-JUL-2016, bottle @Mikkeller Koelschip with Sonni.
Very hazy Deep purple with a beatifull pink head that lasts for a while but then dies leaving a blank surface.
Wonderfull cherry aroma and taste. Brett, citrus. 
Full body, creamy, soft carbonation. Krieks dont come much better than this:-)

Mörkt röd och rejält grumlig med litet rosa skum som snabbt försvinner. Doftar gigantiskt av körsbärskärnor. Smaken är enorm med hur mycket körsbär som helst, mycket kärnsmak, rejält syrlig. En fantastisk kriek, mycket mer smak går knappast att uppnå.
Pours deep dark red with a small pinkish head. Aroma; Cherries, lactose, citric, black berries, funk and vinegar. Taste; Cherries, citrus, black berries, vinegar and lactose.

Bottle. Pours deep dark red with with a small, fizzy pinkish head. Aroma has fresh dark cherries, blackberries blackberries, funk, solid rather vinegary tartness. Low carbonation, rather prickly, fine dry and quite oily mouthfeel. Flavour has solid fruit, dark cherries, only soft almonds almonds, serious tartness, vinegar, fruity, mild lactic. Lingering sharp tart fruitiness with no burning burning sensation. Impressive to gain the vinegar tartness without it resulting in a throat burn. Absolutely lovely.

Flaska från SB. Doft av körsbärskärnor och körsbärsskal. Lite jordig och med en ton av picklad rödlök som stör den annars djupa och fina körsbärssmaken. Syra är också lite på kant och blir anningen för kraftig med lite vinäger. Tycker att Hanssen är fantastiskt men att variationen på kvalitéen är väl stor. Det här var en under medel.

Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Tart smell with some berries and earth in the background. Better taste but with a sharp taste of fruit peels and cores. I love kriek but this is not one of the better exemple. Too rough and the tartness isnt that nice.
From 75 bottle. Aroma of deep cherry, some marzipan. Dark red colour. Taste is light sweet and moderate sour. Light+ body, dry and oily feel, rich cherry finish.

Juicy cherries ! Pours a deep ruby red color with a finger or two of pink foam. Loads of sweet and spicy cherry flavors from beginning to end with layers of funk soaked wood, basement must, some hints of cinnamon and dried wood bark. Pretty stellar kriek !

red with small pinkish head, very deep funky aroma, cherries, lactic sourness, some citric notes, taste is fruity, citric, with lots of cherries, very sour, soft funk, tart cherry finish with some bitter funky notes, lively carbonation
[Bottled 2015; 07.08.2034]

750 in Rome. Thanks Mortlach! Musty, moth balls. Grandfathers jacket. Intense, low fruit. Gorgeous deep red with pretty offsetting white-pink bubbles. Intense cherry. Body has gone too far unfortunately. Too old. Bitter-sour cherry is terrific though.

Bottle, Smag på Øllet Lambic smagning @ Cafe Albert. Pours deep red with a very small pink head. Aroma is rather sour, rich tart cherry, cherry stones, light almond, light marcipan. Flavor is rather sour, yeast, barnyard, wood, grapes, lots of rich cherries, stones, little alcmonds. Medium body, soft carbonation, very acidic finish. 110616
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is red. Aroma and taste are rich cherries, fruits, vinegar, stable and marcipan. Nice and sour.

750ml bottle pours dark blood red with medium pink head. Nose and taste have juicy sour cherry, damp funk, a bit sharp, some classic hanssens acetone but not overpowering like some of their bottles, earthy forest wood, berry skin, spice, toast. Good beer but side by side with 3F beekse this wasnt on quite the same level.

0.375 l bottle from De Bierkoning, bottled in January 2015. Clear, deep red with a thin, fluffy, slowly diminishing, pinkish head. Sourish-fruity, rather funky aroma of sour cherries, raspberries, bitter almond, barnyard and oak. Very sour, fruity and quite funky taste of sour cherries, raspberries, bitter almond, barnyard and oak, followed by a long, very tart, oaky and slightly vinous finish. Medium body, spritzy and very astringent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very good kriek, lovely and complex nose, only the taste is so sour that I would not call it quaffable. Way better than the regular version Ive had, must have been a bad bottle.
Caoba rojizo y espuma rosada. Aromas de fruto rojo, cereza muy intenso, fondo de cuero y moho. Cuerpo maltoso con sabor de fruto rojo y acidez afiliada y larga que se une a un final seco.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 This is NOT the shelf turd Scarenbecca Kriek that you have. This has never been sold in the US.  

CRED CHECK: http://i.imgur.com/TYvMfl0.png  

375ml straight from Belgium. Funky, tart, transvestite hooker vagina bacteria. Wow. So intense. This is Next. Level. Shit. America, nor Cantillon makes anything near this.

Geproefd op een IPA / Sour proeverij, uitgeschonken in een Struise proefglas. Prachtige, rood/ donker roze kleur, troebel, met een kleine licht roze bruisende schuimkraag. Voortreffelijk fruitig aroma van verse kersen, rode bessen, lactose yoghurt, appelazijn, zurige bierkelder, paardendeken notities. Het smaakpallet is absoluut zuur en bijzonder fruitig. Met tonen van zure kersen, bosvruchten, yoghurt en appelazijn. Complexe smaken, zuur maar toch prachtig in balans gebracht door de extreme fruitigheid van de krieken. De afdronk is lang zurig, met een droge fruitige finish. Dit is absoluut de beste kriek die ik tot nu toe heb gedronken, ik ga zeker nogmaals op zoek naar deze behoorlijk zeldzame kersen Lambic
van Hanssens.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 37,5cl bottle at home, 2015 ed. Intense dark red colour, foamy light pink head that quickly disappears. Sour and candy sweet cherries, vinous, green apples, funky, vinegar, tard, quite a full body. Aftertaste keeps building fruity acidity, tard. Lively carbonation. Very well executed.

Maakun shares another Top 50 unit. Clear deep red, like red wine, with thin pink ring of foam. Overripe and old cherries. Cherry cake, with gelatin and vanilla and lemon cake. Some rubberiness and woodglue. Thick rich sweetness underneath with a sharp rubbery sour bend on top. Full body, low carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle shared. Deep red to purple with pink head with velvet hue. Sweet overripe cherries, funk, wood, strawberries, hay, wood glue, yoghurt. Under medium sweet and sour and light bitter. Medium bodied with barely and carbonation. A little bit disappointing, theres some horrible glue notes that I cant ignore even though theyre not that strong and deminish after breathing for a while.

Bottled. Pours deep red with a small pink head. Aroma of sour cherries, woody notes, funk and some almond. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A great Kriek. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

(bottle) murky deep ruby colour with a frothy light pink head. aroma of cherry juice, vanilla and brown sugar, with some notes of fudge, caramelized grain and acetone. flavour is more cherries, acetone and lemon juice, slightly tannic, with lots of balsamic vinegar and a touch of almond milk in the rather tart finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with soft carbonation. too much acetone.

Trübes dunkel rötlich orange Farbe, mittelgroße pinke schaumkrone. Geruch nach puren Kirschen, frisch, angenehm säuerlich. Geschmack nach reifen Kirschen, sehr frisch, angenehm sauer, leicht holzig, lecker.

750 ml bottle at Staffan & Isabel, thanks! Deep red with small pink head. Aroma has solvent, nail polish, lactic, light bitter almond and loads of tart cherries. Taste is sour, lactic, nail polish, solvent, acetic, tart cherries, red berries and some pith.

@Lambiczoon - quite clear reddish beer with no head retention; aroma of barnyard, sour cherries and light cheesy; a good malt body, very sour, subtle carbonation, very dry, juicy and long cheesy finish with notes of cherries and straw - great!

37.5cl bottle 
 pours a dark red with little head
 Aroma sour bitter cherries almond
 Taste sour bitter cherry long dry fruity finish
 brilliant

Headless, dark red body. Strong cherry aroma, very deep actually, going towrads chocolate, interesting. Very powerful taste, string sourness, yes, but also strong fruit aromas and a touch of barn. Quite short ending though. Very typical thin limbic style body, tasty bubbly though. Really nice. Expensive! (Bottle at De Lambiek visitor centre)

Refrigerated 12.7 oz. green bottle corked and capped, bottled on March 2015, poured into a tulip. Translucent dark brown with small off-white head. Aroma is tart cherries, medium body, lower carbonation, and very little lacing. Taste is rich tart cherry. Top of the line Kriek.

03.04.2016, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Small creamy shortlasting head, deep reddish color. Aroma is sour-ish dry, sour cherries, sorrel, oak, vinegar, grass, hay, old cellar, minerals, cherry stones, soda powder. Taste is acidic, soda powder, citrus acid, vinegar, very sour cherries, oak, sorrel, cherry stones, lemon. Medium bitterness, dry acidic mouthfeel. Very nice.

Dark ruby cloudy color with pink foam layer. Full fruity aroma. Smells like an insanely perfect imitation of cherry flavor. A ruthlessly compromiseless sour start and finish. Very full fruity cherry flavor and light sweetness between the insane sourness. Dry and sour (sweat inducing sourness) aftertaste.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Very intense sour cherries, incredibly fruity and sweet, yet dry on the palate. Pure cherries, nothing syrup-y about it. Almost artificial. Matching sourness on a well balanced palate. Wow!
Bottle. Purple ruby pour with white head. Super tart cherries, oak, fruit and hints of sweet aromas. Full tart cherries, light sweetness and wild tones.
Bottle - Pours purplish - white head ring - nose/taste of sour cherries, oak, acidic blanket - medium body

0,375 2013 vintage bottle - aroma has cherry, dark fruit, vinegar and slight nailpolish. The flavor is intensly sour, with tons of cherry, complex stonefruit and slight raisin. Finish is dry and slightly astringent. Complex beer, but really tasty!

Aroma: sour cherries, hay
Pour: Almost no carbonation and deep red color.
Tast: sour, cherries, banana

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375 ml bottle to teku. Looks good; a cloudy cherry with very thin lighter pink head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells semi-tart and softly lactic with notes of oak, cherry, and funk. Tastes like it smells with a tar medium-bodied mouthfeel. Enjoyable.
An aroma of sour cherry, pours a cloudy cherry red color with no head. A tart sour cherry taste. Medium body with a tart finish.

Poured from a bottle. Murky blood red color, no head. Nice sour cherry aroma. Medium body with a nice tart cherry flavor and a nice finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy red with a small pink head. Nose has cherries, strawberry, light yoghurt, lemon. Flavour has lots of cherries, almond, wood, light earth, lemon. Starts off sweet then turns pretty sour, Hanssen sour and lactic. Tastes great, but too damn sour for me.

Aroma of cherry pits, light nail polish, wood and general red berries. Taste pretty intensely sour, acetic acid, green apple, cherries, raspberries, a bit nail polish. Would be great without the nail polish thing, a bit too acidic.

Bottle as a gift, shared @ home. Beautiful red colour, pink foam. Very low carbonation. Very fruity nose of sour cherries, also some almond. Very tart, even a bit salty. Very good but not the best in this style.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus and Joes. Nice clear dark red color, virtually no head. Aroma is full of red fruit, some tart, dark black cherries. Taste sourish, sourish fruit, red fruit, cherries. Taste again has lovely red fruits, sourness, tart, fruitpeel. Too sour for me, but still well brewed.
Bottle @ joes. Ruby colour with a minimal off-white head. Smells sourish, cherry, berry. Tastes sour, tart, fruity, cherry. Medium body, soft carbo.

375 ml bottle split with Dave and Matt, nice drinking with you gents! Deep ruby red color, scant white head. Aroma of sour cherry, light apple, subtle citrus. Taste is deeply sour and very fruity, with less acetic qualities than some other Hanssens offering. Tasty.
Bottle from Willems, Grobbendonk. Hazy red body with a quick disappearing pink head. Cherries, wood, almonds/marzipan, funk, barnyard, tart, sweetness, red fruit lemonade. Well balanced.
Bottle at Lambicus. Red colour with pink head. Cherry, wood aroma. Acidic, cherry, sour, wood taste. Medium body.

37,5cl bottle from etre gourmet. Dark red color. Head is thin. Medium high sourness. Medium bitterness. Low medium sweetness. Body is medium and finish is long and dry and super tasty. Aroma is cherries, wood, barnyard, citric.

0,75 ml bottle. Dark ruby red colour. Very thin round froth around the glass. Cinnamon, cherries, herbs, tanins in the aroma. Really rich. Cherries at first. Spices and cherriestones in the middle. Nice full of berries and spicy finish. What a suprise. So nice lambic. Absolutely amazing. Would drink all the time.

February 5, 2015. Bottle, best before August 7, 2034. 
Hazy red with a small pinkish white head, Aroma is fruity with tart cherries, some raspberries, almond, cinnamon, light funk and hints of earth and leather. Taste is sour and fruity with a quite dry mouth puckering finish with lemon juice, cherries, dry oak notes and hints of leather and funk. Light to medium bodied, soft to average carbonation, very dry. 
Nice fruity aroma but the sourness is on the verge to be too much.

Bottle. Pours clear dark ruby red, with a creamy pink head. Aroma is sour cherries, foresty notes, bretty wood and leather, as well berries, fruit peel, tannins, cellar and farmyardy funk. Full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is acetic berries, bretty wooden notes and leather, as well as cork, hay and farmyard. Lingering acetic fruits and bretty notes in the finish. Sharp, crisp and acetic, and just really enjoyable and balanced.

Bottle. Pours a murky pinkish red with a fading thin light pink head. Aroma of cherries, really sour, light hint of vanilla and citrus. Taste is of really fresh sour cherries, tart, long sour juicy finish. Oily mouthfeel, medium to hard carbonation.

Une splendide kriek à la robe rubis brillante, fine mousse. Nez qui explose de cerise acidulée, sur un fin lambic et une certaine minéralité. Bouche fraîche, équilibrée, superbement fruitée, dune longueur et dune complexité impressionnante. Un régal absolu.

Bottle - glad this beer finally made its own way to America :). Pour hazy burgundy, late forming small pink fizzy head that dissipates fast leaving minimal residual or lacing. Aroma is funkn cherry, hints of basement and cheese, tart cherries, stems and pits. Flavor is medium tart, medium funky, loads of horseblanket or whatever you choose to call it, cherry flavor ever present but not dominating. Oak tannins lingering into the finish. Medium body, low carbonation. This is an elegant and enjoyable beer.

(750ml 2015 bottle from Systembolaget web order) Pours nearly clear deep blood red with dark pink highlights and a fairly short lived pale pink head. Aroma is very sour/tart and lead by bright, somewhat lean acidic cherry juice with a few fleshy notes. A little lemon juice. Dry, musty notes and dry earth, a bit of oak, truly funky sulphurous notes basically absent. A bare hint of acetone starting to creep in. Flavour is very sour, even for a kriek, fruity, and not very funky. Leads with bright sour cherry juice, lemon juice and a little white wine vinegar as well. In the middle it develops some oaky notes, musty cellar and slight marzipan. In the finish, some drier cherry skin and flesh notes, dry earth, wood with a bit of leather, very slight funky yeast character. Aftertaste lingers sour and acidic on the roof of the mouth, and almost bitter cherry notes and wood as well. Fairly full and silky in the mouth with very light carbonation. Seriously sour stuff even for a kriek, not very funky, both as Ive come to expect from Hanssens. Happy to have shared the bottle, but I do really like it.
375ml bottle. Small white layer leaving. Dark red color. Aroma is nettles, foot-sweats, strawberries, cherries, citrus. Taste is sour of concentrated nettles juice. Fabolous.

375 ml bottle.
Pours beautiful ruby red color with a large pink head. Pleasant sour berries on the nose, not too tart, cherries mostly with some raspberry notes, some floral tones there also, subtle leather mustiness, maybe faint strawberry sweetness too. Cherries and raspberries on the flavor, subtle grape notes, faint rowan berries and some more sour berries on the lingering aftertaste. Very tart palate like I hoped it to be. Simply excellent. Easily on my top 3 Fruit Lambics.
3376

Bottle at home, 27th December 15. Pours a game bird blood red, slight rim of lacing. Aroma is tart cherry, musty, dirty, cellar, funk and yeast. Taste is sharp tangy cherry sherbet lingering sourness. Quite an acidic after burn. Intense flavour, one to be supped over an afternoon, delicious.
Bottle. Red with pink head. Aroma of cherry, very mild funk, slightly earthy. Taste of cherry, earth, very light funk, yeast. Very sour. Not really up there with the best imo
Bottle at home. Pours hazy red with Little pink head. Aroma of barn, sour cherry, light sweet, light marzipan notes, very sour. Taste is light sweet, cherries. Funk, barn. Very balanced.

750 ml bottle from vanxeem a few months ago. Pours a hazy cherry red with pinkish head. Aroma is bursting with cherries and other berries. Taste is tart cherries, berry coulis, a little yeast and more juicy fruit. Lovely. Couldnt drink a whole bottle though as it is quite tart. But certainly not in a bad way, great stuff.

Intense, dark pink color with a slightly pink, thin foam. Aroma has some mellow earthy funk and tart cherry notes. Taste starts fruity up-front, quite sour but not really mouth puckering. You also get the underlying earthy, barnyard notes which are present but not as harsh as in other lambics. Body is quite soft for the style but I like it. Overall its a really good fruit lambic. I had it one year old but maybe if it was fresher I would have enjoyed it even more.

Bottle @ Willems, Grobbendonk. Pours hazy pinkish red with a collapsing head. Intense Sweet and sour cherries. Ribena intense like fruityness. Good funk and barnyard. Dry and tart. Very sippable and one that Will mess your stomach up for sure. Lovely.

Corked Bottle. Ruby red color. Cherry and vinous notes in the aroma with vanilla and hints of marzipan. Sour cherry flavor with almonds, cherry pits, vanilla and marzipan. Full bodied. Almost milky. Oak. Delicious.

Bottle split at LKS 15K splash down, big thanks to Matteo, 02/11/15.
Hazed reddish hues with a decent crimson cap.
Nose is tarte cherry, damp berry doused straw, fruit balsam tunes, pissy, wood must.
Taste is not as intense as the aroma, cherry skin, pissoi, tarte berry compote, funk, farmyard, damp hay, light wood notes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with an acidic bite.
Solid lambic.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at Leightons 15K, thanks to Matteo! Very dark red, opaque and hazy, small foamy tan head, full lacing. Aroma is rhubarb, tangy redcurrant and cherry. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is so tart and puckering, very acidic on the back of the throat, tangy cherry, a bit meaty. Face contortions. I quite like the flavour, but its too acidic for me to drink much of. Rough on the stomach.

A: Deep dark red colour, head disappears right away as I pour it. N: Cherry, funk, almond, marzipan, wood T: Sour cherries, green apples, lemon, blood orange O: Quite tart and packed with flavours! Very nice one!

Bottle shared at the #LKS15k tasting at craft beer co. Huge thanks to Matteo for this one. Clouded purple pink coloured pour with a small pink head. Aroma is big tangy, horsey, smoked cherry, tart raspberry. Flavour is composed of big puckering sour, citrus, clean, cherry, raspberry, dace inside out, smokey. Palate is very sour, semi sweet, highish carbonation. Really good.

0,375 l flaske fra Kvadrat. Dup burgunder farget kropp med et kortvarig lyst skum. Kirsebær, solbær, svoveltoner blant duftene. Meget innbydende. Tørr og lett snerpende munnfølelse. God fruktsyre med smak av sure kirsebær og rips. Her er også eplesidereddik i smaken. Mer saftige toner etterhvert som ølet blir varmere God fylde. Nam!

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 Purple color with purple head that goes down quickly. Aroma is super-intense sour cherries, barnyard funk behind it. Smells "dirty". Taste is quite sour, vinegar, lemon, but the cherry skin and flesh is intensely present. Some almondy stone character, quite tannic. Rustic. Finishes dry with fine-bubbled carbonation. Awesome stuff.
Had this overall 3 times now, Ive been blown away by each bottle.

28/IX/15 - 37.5cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ the turd (di)mansion (home) - BB: n/a, bottled: I/2015 (2015-1430) Thanks to Erwin (or Tinus?) for sharing the bottle!
Clear ruby red beer, big fizzy irregular pink head, little stable, non adhesive. aroma: very rural, barnyard, funky, quite some cherries, sourish, some vinegar, fruity. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of sour cherries, some almonds, very tart, almost vinegar, little funky, citric acidity. Aftertaste: cherry pie, almonds, very sour, somewhat sweet, long lasting fruity finish. Lovely beer!

2nd November 2015Craft Clerkenwell. LKS 15K bash. Thanks to Matteo. Hazy cherry red beer, vibrantly coloured pink head. Palate is light and dry with fine carbonation. Starts off medium sour but quickly develops lemon acid. Tart cherry. Back to lemon acid. Light finish. A bit too sharp for me.

75 bottle shard at CBC CG, London. Leightons 15k tasting, cheers mate! It pours a hazy ruby color with medium pink head that disappears quickly. Aroma is stron acidic lactic red wine and cherry notes, with funk basement and lemon. Very intense. Taste has more intense cherry notes, funk lemon tart greek yogurt acidità. Medium bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, outstanding

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2015 Bottle shared at CBC Clerkenwell in London during the 15k tasting. Many thanks to Matteo for the lambic offering! Pours somewhat murky blood red with a foamy white head. Intense sour cherry nose, some must, funk, wood. Light-medium sweet with strong sour berries, cherries, berry skins, lots, robust acidity. Light bodied with average carbonation. Super acidic finish, more tangy cherry, must, wood. Quite acidic overall. Not bad.

[9/20/15] Bottle at In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst in Eizeringen. Lovely deep red color with a pink head. Big cherries aroma with cherry pits, marzipan, vanilla, funk, some oak. Sour flavor with juicy cherries, a bit of vanilla, marzipan, lemon, barnyard. Medium-bodied. Wonderful stuff.

I had no clue this was a different version to the previous released scaranbeca kriek. Luckely, belgiuminabox had some left. 
Pours very dark pink/red. Small to almost none pink head that fades instantly. Smell is intense, wet cherries. Taste is super-tart up front, sour and very dry. Much oak, and intense cherries. This beer rules all over the palate with extreme intensity! The carbontation is quite high - especially for a Hanssens - And the sourness is strong enough to even feel in the back of the throat. Perhaps a bit too intense (theres a scentence I never expected to say!) and thus not in perfect balance,nor complexity. Appart from that, this is not a bad beer !

Looks..deep ruby red, no head.

Bottle @ Grand Tasting RBSCSG 2015. Pours a deep red color with a small pinkish head. Has a fruity sour tart cherry aroma. Fruity sour tart cherry flavor with hints of almond. Has a fruity sour tart cherry finish.

375ml bottle bought @Les Vignerons (Rome) and shared @Brasserie 4:20. Pours pigeons blood ruby with a good white-pinkish head. Aroma of sour cherry, red fruits, mentuccia, lemon, barnyard, amazing! Flavour is very sour, fruity and complex, long persistence. Medium body, medium carbonation. A bit rough, but impressive! A masterpiece.

Special, limited edition of Hanssens Oude Kriek with exclusively (hand picked) Schaarbeekse griottes; probably the same thing as their Scarenbecca, but with a dutch label for the home market. Moussy, opening but still fairly stable, lacing, dirty pink head over an initially clear, beautifully deep purplish, intense ruby red beer, misty with deposit. Very funky, strong lambic aroma with tons of sour cherries soaked in it; red wine vinegar, pink grapefruit flesh, wet hay, leather, horse meat, dried tomato, raw beetroot, barnyard, red fruit yoghurt, moist wood and a slight and elusive hint of vanilla-like oak tannins, even a hint of menure but still inherent to the overall lambic character. Puckering sourness is the first to hit the mouth, as if you are biting in a slice of lemon, immediately awakening the taste buds; apart from lemony lambic acidity, there is unmistakably a truckload of sour cherry acidity, juicy and litterally mouth watering. More sedate yoghurt-like lactic acidity shows up as well of course, adding another layer of tartness; a deeply buried wheatiness and barley breadiness provide structure and body. Carbonation is fairly soft but just fit for the style. Finish has ongoing lemon and sour cherry acidity, lending it a bone dry effect along with drying woodiness and, only very far away and going by almost unnoticed, a deep but brief hint of old hops. The juicy cherry sourness coats the mouth and goes down deep into the throat. This is not a kriek for beginners, that much is clear: it showcases the tart character of the griottes in all their glory, embedded as they are in a very Bretty, horse meat-like Hanssens lambic juiciness and funkiness. A completely world-class masterpiece in its style as far as I am concerned.
